item.title: Pumping Lemma and Ogden's Lemma
item.description: The Pumping Lemma Formally, the pumping lemma states: Suppose L is a regular language. There exists a p (the pumping length) such that every w in L can be divided into three substrings, satisfying the following conditions: $$ w = xyz $$ $$ |xy| \leq p $$ $$ |y| \geq 1 $$ The above says the length (denoted by the pipe symbol ‘|’) of the substring xy should be less than or equal to the pumping length, and the length of the substring y should be greater than or equal to 1.
